info.description: REST APIs for the dashboard app. Provides storage and manipulation services for datasources, dashboards and the widgets contained in dashboards.
info.title: Dashboard App

parameters.description:
Action to take in regards to bringing back only enabled repos or all repos:
 * true - brings back all repos
 * false - brings back only enabled dashboards

put.description: Predefined repos can only have the is_enabled field updated, anything else will be ignored.

get.summary: Get templates for a user
Get parameters

parameters.name: is_readonly
parameters.description:
Action to take in regards to bringing back parameters, brings back all if omitted
 * true - brings back only parameters that are read only
 * false - brings back only parameters that are not read only

parameters.name: is_system
parameters.description:
Action to take in regards to bringing back parameters, brings back all if omitted
 * true - brings back only system parameters
 * false - brings back only non-system parameters

put.description: Updates or creates parameters. Expects a list of parameters in the request body. The parameters that have an id will be updated, the parameters that don't have an id property or id set to null will be created, unless there is already an existing parameter with the same name. For parameters to be created, name field is required. For parameters to be updated id field is required, and name field is ignored. That means parameters cannot be renamed.

delete.summary: Delete a parameter associated with the user

get.summary: Get the ids and names of the items referencing a parameter
Get a list of template related notifications for the current user

delete.summary: Dismiss all template related notifications for the current user

parameters.name: repo_id
parameters.description: to dismiss notifications for a particular repository

post.summary: Creates or updates a dashboard based on a template

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the template to install

parameters.name: on_conflict
parameters.description:
Action to take in case of a conflict. A conflict occurs when the template is already installed but the dashboard based on this template was modified by the user after the last install/update.
 There are 3 possible actions:
 * overwrite - Overwrites the existing dashboard/items with the ones in the template
 * create - Preserves the existing dashboard and creates a new dashboard based on the template. The existing dashboard will not be associated with the template anymore, instead, the newly created dashboard will be associated with the template. For items included in the dashboard, the items that are not modified by the user since last install/update will be overwritten. The items that are modified by the user will be preserved and new items will be created.
 * fail - (default) Responds with 409 status and either of the following error codes:
 E_INSTALL_TEMPLATE_DASHBOARD_CONFLICT E_INSTALL_TEMPLATE_ITEMS_CONFLICT

parameters.name: on_parameter_conflict
parameters.description:
Action to take in case there are some existing parameters with the same names but with different default values than the ones in the template being installed. An existing parameter doesn't cause a conflict if it has no default value, in that case the value in the template will be set as default.  Similarly, if a parameter  has no value in the template then the existing value for the parameter is preserved. Possible action values are:
 * overwrite - overwrites the existing parameter values with the ones in the template
 * ignore - ignores the values in the template, i.e., existing default values are preserved
 * fail - (default) responds with 409 status and the following error code:
 E_IMPORT_PARAMETERS_CONFLICT

409.description:
Conflict, codes:
  E_INSTALL_TEMPLATE_DASHBOARD_CONFLICT
  E_INSTALL_TEMPLATE_ITEMS_CONFLICT
  E_IMPORT_PARAMETERS_CONFLICT
  E_DASHBOARD_CONFLICT

Retrieve drilldown dependencies of a dashboard
Get a dashboard item by id

put.description:
This api updates the dashboard item and completely replaces the view definitions of the dashboard item with the provided list.
That means, any view definition that is not included will be removed from the dashboard item.
Any view definition that does not have an id property, or id property set to null in the input list will be added to the dashboard item.
Any view definition that has an id property will be updated.

E_FETCH_USER_CAPABILITIES

E_UNKNOWN

INTERNAL SERVER ERROR, codes:

E_CHECK_QRADAR_FEATURE

get.summary: Get the list of views for the dashboard

post.summary: Add one or more views to the dashboard

put.summary: Update the view collection for a dashboard
put.description:
This api completely replaces the views in the dashboard with the provided list.
That means, any view that is not included will be removed from the dashboard.
Any view that does not have an id property, or id property set to null in the input list will be added to the dashboard.
Any view that has an id property will be updated.

400.description:
Bad Request, codes:

E_VIEW_DEFS_NOT_FOUND

E_VIEWS_NOT_FOUND

E_VIEW_DUPLICATE

E_DASHBOARD_VIEWS_LIMIT_REACHED

parameters.name: on_conflict
parameters.description:
Action to take in case there are existing dashboards or existing items with UUIDs same as the ones being imported:
 * overwrite - overwrites the existing dashboards/items with the ones in the file
 * create - creates new dashboards/items with new, auto-generated UUIDs
 * fail - (default) responds with 409 status and either of the following error codes:
 E_IMPORT_DASHBOARD_CONFLICT_UUID E_IMPORT_ITEMS_CONFLICT_UUID

parameters.name: on_parameter_conflict
parameters.description:
Action to take in case there are some existing parameters with the same names but with different default values than the ones in the imported file. An existing parameter doesn't cause a conflict if it has no default value, in that case the value in the imported file will be set as default. Similarly, if a parameter has no value in the imported file then the existing value for the parameter is preserved. Possible action values are:
 * overwrite - overwrites the existing parameter values with the ones in the imported dashboard
 * ignore - ignores the values in the imported dashboard, i.e., existing default values are preserved
 * fail - (default) responds with 409 status and the following error code:
 E_IMPORT_PARAMETERS_CONFLICT

parameters.name: dry_run
parameters.description: Allows a dry run to check if a dashboard would be imported  without any conflicts without importing the actual dashboard.

400.description:
Bad request, codes:
  E_DASHBOARD_VALIDATION_SCHEMA
  E_INVALID_FILE_FORMAT
  E_INCOMPATIBLE_JSON_SCHEMA_VERSION
  E_IMPORT_CONTAINS_DUPLICATE_VIEW_DEFS

409.description:
Conflict, codes:
 E_IMPORT_DASHBOARD_CONFLICT_UUID
 E_IMPORT_ITEMS_CONFLICT_UUID
 E_DASHBOARD_CONFLICT
 E_IMPORT_PARAMETERS_CONFLICT

parameters.name: on_conflict
parameters.description:
Action to take in case there is an existing dashboard or existing items with UUIDs same as the ones being imported:
 * overwrite - overwrites the existing dashboard/items with the ones in the file
 * create - creates new dashboard/items with new, auto-generated UUIDs
 * fail - (default) responds with 409 status and either of the following error codes:
   E_IMPORT_DASHBOARD_CONFLICT_UUID
   E_IMPORT_ITEMS_CONFLICT_UUID

400.description:
Bad request, codes:
  E_DASHBOARD_VALIDATION_SCHEMA
  E_INVALID_FILE_FORMAT
  E_INCOMPATIBLE_JSON_SCHEMA_VERSION
  E_IMPORT_CONTAINS_DUPLICATE_VIEW_DEFS

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Parameters for a search. If datasource type aql or dynamic_search, then query should be
"query":{
"queryVal": "string" (required)
"resultsLimit": "number" (optional)
}
or if datasource type offense, query should be
"query": {
"fields": "string" (optional)
"filter": "string" (optional)
"sort": "string" (optional)
"resultsLimit": "number" (optional)
}

parameters.name: x-cache-ttl
parameters.description: Specify the time for a search to live in cache before it expires. (in seconds)

get.summary: Get search by search id

parameters.name: prefer
parameters.description: Specify 'wait=N' where N is number of seconds to wait for COMPLETED status of the search.

get.summary: Get results of a search by search id

parameters.name: resultsLimit
parameters.description: resticts the number of elements that are returned in the list.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: filter results by saved search that contain given string in its name or description

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: number of items to be returned per page

get.summary: Get app feature flags

DashboardDataInitializable.description: fields than can be initialized, but that cannot be overwritten

DashboardDataOverwritableAlways.description: fields than can be ovewritten for an existing dashboard both on import and update

DashboardDataForImport.description: fields that can be initialized or overwritten on import

DashboardDataOverwritableOnUpdateOnly.description: fields that can be overwritten on update only not when importing

created.description: the time in milliseconds since epoch since the dashboard was created.

modified.description: the time in milliseconds since epoch since the dashboard was last modified.

href.description: api path to related resource(s). This is only the path, doesn't contain host or port.
api path to related resource(s). This is only the path, doesn't contain host or port.

ItemDataOverwritable.description: the updateable fields of dashboard item

query.description: the structure of this obj could be different based on the datasource

ItemDataInitializable.description: the fields of dashboard item that can be initialized but not overwritten

ItemDataWithViewDefinitionsData.description: the updateable fields of dashboard item and view definitions of the dashboard item

ItemDataWithViewDefinitionsDataForUpdate.description: the updateable fields of dashboard item and view definitions of the dashboard item

ItemMetadata.description: the read-only fields of dashboard item

created.description: milliseconds since epoch when the item was created.

modified.description: milliseconds since epoch when the dashboard was last modified.

is_readonly.description: whether the item is readonly for the current user

ItemMetadataViewDefinitionsExpanded.description: the read-only fields of dashboard item

ViewDefinitionData.description: the updateable fields of a view definition

params.description: view definition configuration such as what fields should be displayed on x-axis or y-axis for a chart. This should NOT contain and dashboard specific configuration such as the position, size etc.

type.description: type of the chart. see GET /api/items/view_types for possible values

ViewDefinitionMetadata.description: the read-only fields of a view definition

ViewDefinitionMetadataExpanded.description: the read-only fields of a view definition

params.description: formatting parameters for the error message

ViewMetadata.description: the read-only fields of a view

ViewMetadataExpanded.description: the read-only fields of a view

ViewData.description: the updateable fields of a view definition

params.description: dashboard specific configuration for the view, position, size etc.

type.description: view type that helps to distinguish between regular views and parameter card.

id.description: id of the view definition the wiew is based on

type.description: see the response of getDatasourceTypes for valid values

check_status.description: true if the datasource is async and need to proceed to the next api inorder to get the result. false if the datasource is sync and you get the result straight away from this api

result.description: query result that is returned back if the datasource is sync

type.description: type of the chart. see GET /api/items/view_types for possible values

json_schema_version.description: the json schema version of a dashboard being imported

TemplateRepositoryConfigList.description: List of template repositories with IDs

TemplateRepositoryConfigPost.description: Fields required to create/update a template repository

dashboard.description: the info of the dashboard associated with the template if the template is installed, null otherwise

count.description: the number of items that have at least one reference to the parameter

name.description: name of the parameter (case insensitive). Required when creating, ignored when updating.

AnyValue.description: Can be any JSON value (object, array, string, number etc.)

count.description: the number of templates created or updated (depending on the type of the notification)

ttl.description:
Specify the time for a token to live before it expires. (in minutes). Token will not expire if ttl is set to 0. If ttl is not provided:
 - 'url_shortening' tokens ttl will default to 24 hours.
 - 'sharing' tokens ttl will default to 0.

TokenMetadata.description: the read-only fields of a token

SharingTokenMetadata.description: the read-only fields of a sharing token

PageDrilldown.description: drilldown to a context sensitive predefined page
